Authors: qian xin guan, Yi-fei li, changlin zhao
Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of the Hyphoderma with descriptions of
three new species from East Asia
Keywords:
Corticioid fungi, Hyphodermataceae, Molecular systematics,
Taxonomy, Yunnan Province
Abstract:
Three new wood-inhabiting fungal species, Hyphoderma
macrocrystallina, H. microporoides and H. vacuspora spp. nov. are
proposed based on a combination of morphological features and molecular
evidence. Hyphoderma macrocrystallina is characterized by the resupinate
basidiomata with smooth hymenial surface scattering the nubby crystal, a
monomitic hyphal system with clamped generative hyphae, and numerous
encrusted cystidia present. Hyphoderma microporoides is characterized by
the resupinate, cottony basidiomata distributing the tiny pinhole on the
hymenial surface, presence of halocystidia and cylindrical to allantoid
basidiospores. Hyphoderma vacuspora is characterized by the resupinate
basidiomata with tuberculate hymenial surface, presence of moniliform
cystidia and ellipsoid to cylindrical basidiospores (1113.5 × 4.55.5
µm). Sequences of ITS+nLSU rRNA gene regions of the studied samples were
generated and phylogenetic analyses were performed with maximum
likelihood, maximum parsimony and Bayesian inference methods. These
phylogenetic analyses showed that three new species clustered into
Hyphoderma, in which H. macrocrystallina was sister to H. variolosum; H.
microporoides closely grouped with H. nemorale; H. vacuspora was
retrieved as a sister species of H. sinense (100% BS, 100% BP and 1.00
BPP).
